meta.title: Calorie Calculator - Daily Calorie Needs | Kalcufy
meta.description: Free calorie calculator to find your daily calorie needs for weight loss, maintenance, or muscle gain based on your activity level.

education.title: Understanding Calories
education.content1: Calories are units of energy. Your body burns calories just to function (BMR) plus additional calories for activity. The balance between calories in and out determines weight change.
education.content2: For weight loss, aim for a 500-calorie daily deficit to lose about 1 lb per week. For muscle gain, add 300-500 calories above maintenance with strength training.

tip1.title: Calories In vs Out
tip1.description: Weight management comes down to energy balance.

tip2.title: Safe Weight Loss
tip2.description: Aim for 0.5-1 lb per week. Faster loss often means muscle loss.

tip3.title: Protein Matters
tip3.description: Higher protein helps preserve muscle during weight loss.

tip4.title: Track Your Intake
tip4.description: People often underestimate calories consumed by 20-50%.

faq.question: How accurate is this calculator?
faq.answer: Calculators estimate within 10-15% accuracy. Track your actual intake and weight changes, then adjust based on real results.

faq.question: Should I eat back exercise calories?
faq.answer: For weight loss, eat about half of exercise calories. Exercise trackers often overestimate calories burned.

faq.question: Why is my maintenance so high/low?
faq.answer: Maintenance varies widely based on height, weight, age, and especially activity level. More muscle also increases metabolism.
